title: [BUG] Resize changes the orientation of some images automatically which is undesirable
body:
**Description**

We're using SkiaSharp to resize our images. For most images, it works just fine. But for some images it rotates them in addition to resizing them, which is undesirable. The rotation is automatic.

**Code**

Code is long. I have attached an image that has this problem.

**Expected Behavior**

It should resize images, without automatically rotating them.

**Actual Behavior**

It resizes images, and for some images it automatically rotates them too.

Since it happens for all version on all operating systems (we have tested Windows and Linux), thus we just provide one image that has this problem. Please test this image.

![random](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/81751123/194540687-d2b259c9-a53f-4079-a70a-754198de8ef9.jpeg)

comments.author: ojb500
comments.body:
This image is actually a landscape image with some EXIF metadata saying that it should be rotated. This is normal for 'portrait' format images from camera phones

```
ExifTool Version Number         : 12.47
File Name                       : 194540687-d2b259c9-a53f-4079-a70a-754198de8ef9.jpeg
[...]
File Type                       : JPEG
File Type Extension             : jpg
MIME Type                       : image/jpeg
Exif Byte Order                 : Big-endian (Motorola, MM)
Orientation                     : Rotate 90 CW
X Resolution                    : 72
Y Resolution                    : 72
[...]
Image Size                      : 4032x3024
Megapixels                      : 12.2
Thumbnail Image                 : (Binary data 6654 bytes, use -b option to extract)
```

Without seeing your code it's difficult to say but you need to either handle this metadata ([SKCodec.EncodedOrigin](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/skiasharp.skcodec.encodedorigin?view=skiasharp-2.88#skiasharp-skcodec-encodedorigin)) or preserve it in your output jpeg.

Related:

https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/issues/836
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/44181914/iphone-image-orientation-wrong-when-resizing-with-skiasharp

comments.author: hosseinitabar
comments.body:
@ojb500 thank you so much for clarification. Now I understand that some photos have this intrinsic metadata.

Can I clean their metadata altogheter?
